sentences.english: The episode should serve as a warning to Europeans.
sentences.chinese: 这个小插曲对欧洲人应是个警讯。

sentences.english: For China, events in Zambia should be a warning sign.
sentences.chinese: 对中国来说，赞比亚发生的事情应该是一个警讯。

sentences.english: Although SARS is a troubling development, we have no good cause to look at it pessimistically.
sentences.chinese: SARS是一个警讯，但是我们没有悲观的权利。

sentences.english: He had two warnings for the commercial human spaceflight community.
sentences.chinese: 他对商业载人太空飞行界提出两个警讯。

sentences.english: Worry is the warning light that God has been shoved to the sideline.
sentences.chinese: 挂念是一个警讯，显示神已被推到一旁。

sentences.english: If you recognize any of the above warning signs the goal is to prevent further damage.
sentences.chinese: 发现上述任一警讯的目标是防止发生进一步的创伤。

sentences.english: It is the latest warning of the dangers of indiscreet tweeting.
sentences.chinese: 这是轻率发表推文的最新警讯。

sentences.english: Immunologists are exploring whether autoantibodies can serve as early warnings in other ways as well.
sentences.chinese: 免疫学家也正开发自体抗体做为早期警讯以外的用途。

sentences.english: The collected personal data is solely used for activities of Junior Police Call.
sentences.chinese: 所收集的个人资料，祇供少年警讯之用。

sentences.english: 'The government data might be a warning, ' says Mr. Shiller.
sentences.chinese: “政府数据似乎可以看作是一个警讯，”席勒说。

definition: to pursue/to be after/to hunt down (the perpetrator of a crime, an escaped prisoner etc)
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
